polepos.title: Pole Position

sources.description: Namco/Atari Pole Position uses optical encoder wheel with infinite rotation capability

polepos.notes: Infinite rotation optical encoder (spinner). Maps better to spinner/mouse input than modern wheel.

harddriv.notes: 10-turn potentiometer with 3-rotation mechanical stop. Uses Atari-custom steering assembly unique among arcade racers.

hummer.title: Hummer

sources.description: SuzoHapp 5K Potentiometer (220-5373/220-5374/220-5484) compatibility list explicitly includes HUMMER MDX and HUMMER STD. This is the standard Sega steering potentiometer used across all Sega 270-degree driving cabinets (OutRun, Daytona, F355, NASCAR, etc.).
BYOAC 'Definitive list of ALL emulated arcade games playable with a 270 degree wheel' explicitly includes 'Hummer Extreme'.

hummer.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. Standard Sega 270-degree wheel with force feedback. Hummer MDX and STD both listed in SuzoHapp 220-5373 potentiometer compatibility catalog alongside all other Sega 270-degree driving games.

hummer_extreme.title: Hummer Extreme Edition

sources.description: SuzoHapp 5K Potentiometer (220-5373/220-5374/220-5484) compatibility list explicitly includes HUMMER MDX (the MDX suffix denotes the Extreme Edition Motion DX cabinet). Same potentiometer as all other Sega 270-degree driving cabinets.
BYOAC 'Definitive list of ALL emulated arcade games playable with a 270 degree wheel' explicitly includes 'Hummer Extreme'.

hummer_extreme.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. Identical steering assembly to Hummer base game. MDX = Motion DX cabinet with seat-only motion. All Hummer variants share the same 270-degree steering assembly.

r_tuned.title: R-Tuned: Ultimate Street Racing

sources.description: SuzoHapp 5K Potentiometer (220-5373/220-5374/220-5484) compatibility list explicitly includes R-TUNED. Same standard Sega steering potentiometer used across all Sega 270-degree driving cabinets.
Dedicated 'SEGA LINDBERGH R Tuned Steering Direction POT w Gear. Bracket.' sold as specific R-Tuned replacement part, confirming the standard Sega steering direction assembly is present.

r_tuned.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. Modified SEGA Race TV cabinet. TeknoParrot also available as R-TunedElf2. Specific steering direction potentiometer bracket sold as R-Tuned replacement part confirms standard Sega assembly.

sega_race_tv.title: SEGA Race TV

sources.description: SuzoHapp 5K Potentiometer (220-5373/220-5374/220-5484) compatibility list explicitly includes 'Sega Race TV'. Same standard Sega steering potentiometer used across all Sega 270-degree driving cabinets.
BYOAC 'Definitive list of ALL emulated arcade games playable with a 270 degree wheel' explicitly includes 'SEGA Race-TV (Export)'.

sega_race_tv.notes: Sega Lindbergh/Europa-R hardware. R-Tuned uses a modified version of this cabinet. TeknoParrot also available as segartvelf2. Explicitly listed in SuzoHapp 220-5373 potentiometer compatibility catalog.

sources.description: Sega Lindbergh standard driving cabinet. Service manual shows standard 8-bit pot steering calibration.

Sega Lindbergh driving cabinets use the standard 5K ohm potentiometer (220-5373/220-5374). Ford Racing uses the same Lindbergh steering assembly as R-Tuned, Hummer, and other verified 270-degree Sega games.

Sega ALLS platform steering assembly: shared steering hardware with documented 270-degree range across Sega ALLS racing cabinets

showdown.notes: Sega PC hardware (RingEdge 2). DiRT: Showdown arcade port. Cabinet lineage: same design as GRID -> SEGA Racing Classic (all 270°). Manual exists but degree spec not directly confirmed from manual text.

sources.description: Radikal Bikers Dedicated Game Operation Manual (Atari 16-30038-101) documents 5K OHM potentiometer for handlebar steering. Test mode HANDLE values: 000 full left, 256 full right, center 108-148. Full 0-256 ADC range indicates ~270° pot travel.
Arcade Controls Forum 270-degree wheel compatibility list includes Radikal Bikers alongside other 270° standard games.

5K ohm potentiometer matches standard 270° arcade steering spec (same as Sega SPG-2002, Gaelco car games). Manual documents geared linkage mechanism from handlebars to pot — physical rotation mechanically reduced to pot range.

radikal_bikers.notes: Gaelco PC hardware. Scooter handlebars with geared linkage to 5K/270° potentiometer — handlebar movement maps to full pot range via mechanical reduction.

sources.description: Direct sequel to Chase H.Q. (confirmed 270 degrees). Taito standard racing cabinet.

need_for_speed_carbon.title: Need for Speed: Carbon
need_for_speed_carbon.notes: Full Logitech G25/DFP wheel support with force feedback (crash impacts, traction loss). G25 clutch and H-shifter work. 900-degree mode available but contested; 270 degrees recommended.

sources.description: Listed as compatible with Logitech Driving Force/DFP in ArcadeControls PS2 wheel game list and GTPlanet Logitech compatibility thread.
NeoGAF thread 'PS2 Burnout 3 IS compatible with Logitech Wheel' confirms retail version works. Force feedback functional in final release despite early reports of removal.
Separate NeoGAF pre-release thread discussed EA demanding FFB removal. Final retail version retained wheel support with force feedback.
Narkive PS2 steering wheel compatible games archive lists Burnout 3 Takedown by Electronic Arts as wheel-compatible.

burnout_3_takedown.title: Burnout 3: Takedown
burnout_3_takedown.notes: Primarily a controller game. Logitech wheel compatible with force feedback in final retail version (despite pre-release reports of FFB removal by EA). Crash-focused gameplay benefits less from wheel input. Not listed in PCSX2 Wiki steering wheel category.

sources.description: Compatible with Logitech Driving Force/DFP per ArcadeControls PS2 wheel list and GTPlanet Logitech compatibility thread.
GameFAQs Q&A thread discusses Logitech Driving Force wheel controls setup for Burnout Revenge PS2.
Narkive PS2 steering wheel compatible games archive lists Burnout Revenge by Electronic Arts as wheel-compatible.
Same Criterion engine as Burnout 3 which has confirmed wheel+FFB support. Burnout Revenge is the sequel with same wheel integration.

burnout_revenge.title: Burnout Revenge
burnout_revenge.notes: Arcade crash racer. Logitech Driving Force/DFP wheel compatible with force feedback. Same Criterion engine as Burnout 3. Not listed in PCSX2 Wiki steering wheel category. Gameplay is crash-focused and benefits less from wheel input.

sources.description: Full 900-degree support with DFP, DFGT, and G25. Force feedback supported. Highly regarded PS2 sim racer.
PCSX2 wheel works but FFB steering resistance only functions with 'Driving Force' type selected (not DFP). GitHub #8935.

enthusia_professional_racing.title: Enthusia Professional Racing
enthusia_professional_racing.notes: Konami's only sim racer. Underrated. PCSX2 users must select 'Driving Force' (not DFP) as emulated wheel type for proper FFB.

sources.description: Compatible with Logitech Driving Force/DFP per ArcadeControls PS2 wheel list. Steering better with wheel than overly sensitive DualShock 2 sticks.
Listed in GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility thread as PS2 wheel-compatible title.
PCSX2 Wiki lists Auto Modellista in 'Games support steering wheel' category, confirming native PS2 USB wheel support.
Narkive PS2 steering wheel compatible games archive lists Auto Modellista by Capcom Entertainment as wheel-compatible.

auto_modellista.title: Auto Modellista
auto_modellista.notes: Cel-shaded racer by Capcom. US version subtitled 'US Tuned'. Logitech Driving Force/DFP wheel compatible with force feedback. Wheel provides significantly better control than oversensitive DualShock 2 analog sticks.

sources.description: DualShock 2 controller only. Not compatible with USB racing wheels. Options menu does not acknowledge wheel peripherals.
PCSX2 Wiki lists game compatibility but NOT in 'Games support steering wheel' category.
The Virtua Planet detailed review confirms: 'It's not compatible with racing wheels — at least not the one I own — nor does its options menu acknowledge their existence.'
Not listed in Logitech Driving Force PS2 compatibility lists (GTPlanet, ArcadeControls). Absent from all PS2 wheel-compatible game lists surveyed.

driving_emotion_type_s.title: Driving Emotion Type-S
driving_emotion_type_s.notes: Square's only PS2 racing game (developed by Escape subsidiary). Does NOT support steering wheels — DualShock 2 only. Ultra-sensitive analog steering; options menu has no wheel settings. Early PS2 launch-window title, pre-dates Logitech GT Force (2001).

toca_race_driver_2.title: TOCA Race Driver 2

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms 900-degree steering support with force feedback on PS2.
Codemasters TOCA/Race Driver series: all PS2 entries use 540-degree touring car rotation standard. Sequel to Pro Race Driver with same wheel SDK.

toca_race_driver_2.notes: Touring car sim. Full Logitech DFP 900-degree support with FFB. 540 degrees matches touring car handling. Also known as DTM Race Driver 2 in Europe.

toca_race_driver_3.title: TOCA Race Driver 3

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki lists TOCA Race Driver 3 in 'Games support steering wheel' category.
Codemasters TOCA/Race Driver series: consistent 540-degree touring car standard across all entries. Same wheel SDK as predecessors.

toca_race_driver_3.notes: Final TOCA Race Driver on PS2. Full wheel and FFB support. Also known as DTM Race Driver 3 in Europe and V8 Supercars 3 in Australia.

nfs_hot_pursuit_2.title: Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit 2

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for NFS Hot Pursuit 2 on PS2.
PCSX2 forums confirm USB wheel emulation works. SLUS-20362.

nfs_hot_pursuit_2.notes: Early PS2 NFS. Logitech Driving Force compatible. Pre-DFP era, limited to 200-degree rotation.

nfs_prostreet_ps2.title: Need for Speed: ProStreet

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki documents NFS ProStreet compatibility. USB wheel emulation supported.
Later EA NFS title with Logitech DFP/G25 support. 540-degree rotation matches the game's semi-sim track racing focus.

nfs_prostreet_ps2.notes: Track-focused NFS entry. Full DFP/G25 support with FFB. Semi-sim handling benefits from higher rotation than arcade NFS titles.

colin_mcrae_rally_3.title: Colin McRae Rally 3

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki documents Colin McRae Rally 3 compatibility. Listed with steering wheel support.
GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Colin McRae Rally 3 on PS2.

colin_mcrae_rally_3.notes: Rally sim with full Logitech wheel support. Codemasters' rally series on PS2. 540 degrees matches rally handling.

midnight_club_3_dub_edition.title: Midnight Club 3: DUB Edition

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms 900-degree steering support for Midnight Club 3: DUB Edition on PS2.
Arcade street racer. 270 degrees matches fast arcade handling. Sequel to Midnight Club II with same snappy physics.

midnight_club_3_dub_edition.notes: Arcade street racer. Logitech wheel compatible with force feedback. Arcade physics suit lower rotation. DUB Edition Remix (SLUS-21355) is an updated version.

f1_2001_ps2.title: F1 2001 (EA Sports)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for F1 2001 on PS2.
PCSX2 Wiki documents F1 2001 compatibility.

f1_2001_ps2.notes: EA Sports F1 sim for PS2. Early PS2 wheel era, limited to 200-degree GT Force rotation. Logitech Driving Force compatible.

f1_2002_ps2.title: F1 2002 (EA Sports)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for F1 2002 on PS2.
Sequel to F1 2001 with same EA UK engine and Logitech wheel SDK. Pre-DFP era, 200-degree max.

f1_2002_ps2.notes: EA Sports F1 sim for PS2. Sequel to F1 2001 with same wheel integration. Pre-DFP era, limited to 200-degree rotation.

grand_prix_challenge.title: Grand Prix Challenge

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Grand Prix Challenge on PS2.
PCSX2 Wiki documents Grand Prix Challenge compatibility.

grand_prix_challenge.notes: F1 racing game by Melbourne House (Infogrames). Logitech Driving Force compatible.

r_racing_evolution.title: R: Racing Evolution

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for R: Racing Evolution on PS2.
Namco racing game. Namco PS2 racers use 270-degree standard matching their arcade potentiometer hardware.

r_racing_evolution.notes: Namco's story-driven racer. Logitech wheel compatible. 270 degrees matches Namco's arcade racing standard.

juiced_ps2.title: Juiced

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Juiced on PS2.
Street racing game with semi-realistic handling. 540 degrees matches tuner car feel.

juiced_ps2.notes: Street racing game with tuning. Logitech Driving Force compatible.

tokyo_xtreme_racer_zero.title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer: Zero

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki documents Tokyo Xtreme Racer: Zero compatibility.
Highway racer with arcade handling. 270 degrees suits the high-speed highway racing gameplay.

tokyo_xtreme_racer_zero.notes: Highway street racer. Early PS2 title. Known as Shutokou Battle 0 in Japan.

tokyo_xtreme_racer_3.title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer 3

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki lists Tokyo Xtreme Racer 3 in 'Games support steering wheel' category.
Highway racer with arcade handling. Same Genki engine as TXR Zero. 270 degrees suits highway racing gameplay.

tokyo_xtreme_racer_3.notes: Highway street racer. Wheel support confirmed by PCSX2 Wiki. Known as Shutokou Battle 01 in Japan.

tokyo_xtreme_racer_drift_2.title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer: Drift 2

sources.description: PCSX2 forums document wheel support for Tokyo Xtreme Racer: Drift 2. SLUS-21394.
Genki TXR series drift racer. 270 degrees suits the touge/drift racing gameplay. Also known as Kaido Battle: Touge no Densetsu.

tokyo_xtreme_racer_drift_2.notes: Mountain pass drift racer. Known as Kaido Battle: Touge no Densetsu in Japan. Final TXR game on PS2.

tourist_trophy.title: Tourist Trophy

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Tourist Trophy on PS2. Uses GT4 engine.
Built on Gran Turismo 4 engine by Polyphony Digital. Uses same DFP 900-degree wheel SDK. Motorcycle game but supports steering wheel for car-like handling mode.

tourist_trophy.notes: Polyphony Digital motorcycle sim built on GT4 engine. Despite being a motorcycle game, supports Logitech DFP/G25 wheels with 900-degree rotation and FFB. The GT4-based physics engine uses the same wheel SDK.

pro_race_driver.title: Pro Race Driver

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Pro Race Driver on PS2.
First in Codemasters TOCA/Race Driver series on PS2. 540-degree touring car standard used across the whole series.

pro_race_driver.notes: First TOCA Race Driver on PS2 (US title: Pro Race Driver, EU: TOCA Race Driver / DTM Race Driver). Touring car sim with story mode. Logitech wheel compatible with FFB.

test_drive_eve_of_destruction.title: Test Drive: Eve of Destruction

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms 900-degree steering support with FFB for Test Drive: Eve of Destruction on PS2.
PCSX2 Wiki documents Test Drive: Eve of Destruction compatibility.

test_drive_eve_of_destruction.notes: Demolition derby racer. Full Logitech DFP 900-degree support with FFB. 540 degrees recommended for demolition derby handling.

corvette_ps2.title: Corvette

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Corvette on PS2.
Arcade-style Corvette history racer. 270 degrees suits the arcade handling model.

corvette_ps2.notes: Corvette history showcase racing game. Logitech Driving Force compatible. Also released as Corvette Evolution GT in PAL regions.

total_immersion_racing.title: Total Immersion Racing

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Total Immersion Racing on PS2.
PCSX2 Wiki documents Total Immersion Racing compatibility.

total_immersion_racing.notes: GT racing sim. Logitech wheel compatible. 18 licensed cars.

nascar_06_total_team_control.title: NASCAR 06: Total Team Control

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for NASCAR series on PS2.
EA NASCAR PS2 series with Logitech wheel support. 540 degrees matches oval/stock car racing.

nascar_06_total_team_control.notes: EA NASCAR sim with team strategy. Logitech wheel compatible. 540 degrees suits oval racing.

starsky_and_hutch.title: Starsky & Hutch

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support for Starsky & Hutch on PS2.
Arcade action driving game. 270 degrees suits the chase/pursuit gameplay.

starsky_and_hutch.notes: TV show tie-in driving game. Arcade chase gameplay. Logitech Driving Force compatible. No force feedback.

nascar_thunder_2003.title: NASCAR Thunder 2003

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki confirms steering wheel category, serial SLUS-20535

nascar_thunder_2003.notes: Supports Logitech Driving Force and NASCAR Racing Wheel. Pre-DFP era, rumble feedback only.

nascar_thunder_2004.title: NASCAR Thunder 2004

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki and Archive.org confirm serial SLUS-20824

nascar_thunder_2004.notes: Last NASCAR Thunder game. Logitech sold a NASCAR Racing Wheel bundle with this title.

nascar_2005_chase.title: NASCAR 2005: Chase for the Cup

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki confirms steering wheel support, serial SLUS-21003

nascar_2005_chase.notes: First EA NASCAR game to drop 'Thunder' from title. Supports Logitech Driving Force.

ford_mustang_legend_lives.title: Ford Mustang: The Legend Lives

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support
GameFAQs walkthrough by WDixon confirms Logitech Driving Force and DFP as only supported wheels

ford_mustang_legend_lives.notes: Part of Ford Racing series. Features 40 Mustang models 1964-2005. Only supports Logitech DF and DFP wheels.

vrally_3.title: V-Rally 3

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel and FFB support
PCSX2 Wiki and forums confirm serial SLUS-20496, steering wheel category

vrally_3.notes: Rally racing game with new physics engine. PS2 version released NA 2002, ported to Xbox/GC/PC 2003.

wrc_ps2.title: WRC: World Rally Championship (PS2)

sources.description: Arcadecontrols.com PS2 Steering Wheel Support Games List confirms wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki confirms serial SLUS-20419

wrc_ps2.notes: Only WRC game with NTSC-U PS2 release. Developed by Evolution Studios (later MotorStorm, DriveClub). WRC II-IV were PAL only.

rally_fusion_roc.title: Rally Fusion: Race of Champions

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki lists game in steering wheel games category, serial SLUS-20361
PCSX2 Forums thread confirms serial SLUS-20361. Off-road rally game featuring Race of Champions licensed event.

rally_fusion_roc.notes: Off-road rally game featuring Race of Champions licensed event. Wheel support reported via PCSX2 emulation but not confirmed with real hardware. Not on GTPlanet Driving Force list.

cmr_04.title: Colin McRae Rally 04

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms Colin McRae series wheel support
PCSX2 forums confirm serial SLES-51824 (PAL only, no NTSC-U release)

cmr_04.notes: PS2 version was PAL-only. Xbox version released in NA. Supports Logitech Driving Force.

cmr_2005.title: Colin McRae Rally 2005

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki lists in steering wheel games category, serial SLES-52636 (PAL only)
GTPlanet Driving Force compatibility confirms Colin McRae series wheel support

cmr_2005.notes: PS2 version PAL-only. Xbox and PC released in NA. Supports USB wheels.

richard_burns_rally_ps2.title: Richard Burns Rally (PS2)

sources.description: GTPlanet Driving Force compatibility list confirms DFP 900-degree support
Arcadecontrols.com steering wheel games list confirms PS2 wheel support

richard_burns_rally_ps2.notes: One of the most realistic rally sims ever. One of few PS2 games supporting 900-degree rotation via DFP. PS2 version PAL-only (NTSC-U cancelled). PC version has famous RBR-NGP modding community.

lotus_challenge.title: Lotus Challenge

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki lists Lotus Challenge in steering wheel games category. PAL serial SLES-50230 confirmed.

lotus_challenge.notes: PS2 version PAL-only. NA release planned by Interplay but cancelled. Xbox/GC versions released in NA by Xicat.

knight_rider_game.title: Knight Rider: The Game

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms wheel support
PSX DataCenter confirms PAL serial SLES-51011. Driving/action game based on TV series with wheel-compatible driving segments.

knight_rider_game.notes: PS2 version PAL-only. PC version released in NA. Driving/action game based on TV series. Wheel enhances driving segments.

formula_one_2003_sl.title: Formula One 2003 (Studio Liverpool)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms F1 2003 wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki confirms steering wheel support, serial SCES-51592 (PAL only)

formula_one_2003_sl.notes: Studio Liverpool F1 series (distinct from EA's F1 games). PAL/Japan only, never released in North America.

formula_one_04_sl.title: Formula One 04 (Studio Liverpool)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms F1 04 wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki lists in steering wheel category, serial SCES-52426 (PAL only)

formula_one_04_sl.notes: Studio Liverpool F1 series (distinct from EA's F1 games). PAL/Japan only. Last F1 game before series became 'Formula One Championship Edition' on PS3.

sega_rally_2006.title: Sega Rally 2006

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki lists in steering wheel games category, serial SLPM-66212 (NTSC-J only)
Wikipedia confirms GT Force Pro wheel bundle sold in Japan for this game. Logitech LPRC-11000C custom edition.

sega_rally_2006.notes: Japan-only PS2 release. First Sega Rally not based on an arcade game. Sega sold a custom GT Force Pro wheel bundle. Includes Sega Rally Championship 1995 as bonus.

burnout_ps2.title: Burnout (PS2)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms Burnout wheel support
Arcade Controls PS2 Steering Wheel Support Games List confirms wheel compatibility

burnout_ps2.notes: First Burnout game. Pre-DFP era (200° max). Supports Logitech Driving Force and Momo Force wheels. Burnout Dominator is the only Criterion Burnout that does NOT support wheels.

burnout_2.title: Burnout 2: Point of Impact

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms Burnout 2 wheel support
Arcade Controls and NeoGAF confirm wheel works great with Burnout 2

burnout_2.notes: Second Burnout game. Pre-DFP era (200° max). Supports Logitech Driving Force GT and Momo Force wheels. Great wheel experience reported by community.

wrc_ii_extreme.title: WRC II Extreme

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki lists WRC II Extreme, PAL serial SCES-50934
Same Evolution Studios engine and hardware as WRC 1 (confirmed wheel support). PAL-only sequel.

wrc_ii_extreme.notes: PAL-only sequel to WRC: World Rally Championship. Same Evolution Studios engine. Features all 14 official WRC 2002 events.

formula_one_05_sl.title: Formula One 05 (Studio Liverpool)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms F1 05 wheel support
PCSX2 Wiki has Formula One 05 page, PAL serial SCES-53033

formula_one_05_sl.notes: Studio Liverpool F1 series. PAL-only, never released in North America. Career mode with 5-year progression and interactive pit stops.

formula_one_06_sl.title: Formula One 06 (Studio Liverpool)

sources.description: PCSX2 Wiki has Formula One 06 page, PAL serial SCES-53950
Same Studio Liverpool engine and wheel support as F1 03, F1 04, F1 05. Last PS2 F1 game before PS3 Championship Edition.

formula_one_06_sl.notes: Final Studio Liverpool F1 game on PS2. PAL-only. Also released on PSP. Based on 2006 FIA season.

wrc_3_ps2.title: WRC 3 (PS2)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms WRC 3 wheel support with force feedback
Same Evolution Studios engine as WRC 1-2. PAL serial SCES-51684. First in series to support DFP wheels.

wrc_3_ps2.notes: Third WRC game by Evolution Studios. PAL-only. Supports Logitech Driving Force Pro with force feedback. Pre-DFP era wheel still 200° max but DFP was 270°.

wrc_4_ps2.title: WRC 4: The Official Game of the FIA World Rally Championship (PS2)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms WRC 4 wheel support with force feedback
Same Evolution Studios engine as WRC 1-3. PAL serial SCES-52389. Different game from Milestone's 2013 Steam WRC 4.

wrc_4_ps2.notes: Fourth WRC game by Evolution Studios. PAL-only. Not related to Milestone's 2013 WRC 4 on Steam. Supports DFP with FFB.

wrc_rally_evolved.title: WRC: Rally Evolved

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms WRC Rally Evolved wheel and FFB support
Final Evolution Studios WRC on PS2. Supports DFGT 900° but 540° is recommended rally setting. PAL serial SCES-53247.

wrc_rally_evolved.notes: Final Evolution Studios WRC on PS2. PAL-only. Significant graphics upgrade. 540° recommended for rally driving style.

initial_d_special_stage.title: Initial D: Special Stage

sources.description: PS2 port of Initial D Arcade Stage 1-3 content. Arcade versions used 540° wheels (confirmed by TeknoParrot metadata for ID4-ID8).
GTPlanet and racing communities confirm Initial D Special Stage supports Logitech DFP and DFGT wheels on PS2

initial_d_special_stage.notes: Japan-only PS2 port of Initial D Arcade Stage series. NTSC-J serial SLPM-65268. Supports DFP/DFGT wheels. 540° matches arcade cabinet specification.

ferrari_f355_challenge_ps2.title: Ferrari F355 Challenge (PS2)

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms F355 Challenge PS2 wheel support
PS2 port of Sega arcade game (270° cabinet). NTSC-U serial SLUS-20558. Arcade original uses SPG-2002 270° steering.

ferrari_f355_challenge_ps2.notes: PS2 port of Sega's arcade F355 Challenge. 270° matches the arcade cabinet's SPG-2002 steering assembly. Supports Logitech Driving Force wheel.

f1_career_challenge.title: F1 Career Challenge

sources.description: GTPlanet Logitech Driving Force compatibility list confirms F1 Career Challenge wheel support
Arcade Controls PS2 wheel compatibility list confirms F1 Career Challenge works with steering wheels

f1_career_challenge.notes: EA Sports F1 game spanning 1999-2002 seasons. NTSC-U serial SLUS-20693. Career mode across multiple F1 seasons.

gran_turismo_5_prologue.title: Gran Turismo 5 Prologue

sources.description: Polyphony Digital GT series. Full Logitech G25/G27 support with 900-degree rotation, H-pattern shifter, and clutch.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status. Full wheel support via emulated G27.

gran_turismo_5_prologue.notes: PS3-exclusive GT prequel. Full 900-degree wheel support with FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

gran_turismo_5.title: Gran Turismo 5

sources.description: Polyphony Digital GT5. Full Logitech G25/G27/DFGT support with 900-degree rotation, H-pattern shifter, clutch, and shift LEDs.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status with wheel support via emulated G27.
GTPlanet community extensively documents GT5 wheel compatibility. Gold standard for PS3 sim racing.

gran_turismo_5.notes: PS3-exclusive flagship sim racer. Gold standard for PS3 wheel gaming. Full 900-degree support, H-shifter, clutch, shift LEDs. Playable on RPCS3.

gran_turismo_6.title: Gran Turismo 6

sources.description: Polyphony Digital GT6. Full Logitech/Thrustmaster/Fanatec wheel support with 900-degree rotation.
RPCS3 Wiki lists as Ingame status. Wheel support works but game has stability issues beyond v1.05.
GTPlanet community confirms extensive wheel and FFB support.

gran_turismo_6.notes: PS3-exclusive. Last GT title on PS3. Full 900-degree wheel support. RPCS3 status: Ingame (stability issues on newer patches).

ridge_racer_7.title: Ridge Racer 7

sources.description: Logitech official PS3 compatibility list confirms 200-degree mode and FFB support for G25/G27.
Ridge Racer series consistently uses 270-degree arcade-style steering. PS3 launch title.

ridge_racer_7.notes: PS3-exclusive launch title. Arcade racer with partial wheel support. RPCS3 status: Ingame.

dirt.title: DiRT

sources.description: Logitech official PS3 compatibility list confirms 200-degree mode and FFB for Colin McRae: DiRT.
Codemasters rally series. Native wheel support across the DiRT franchise.

dirt.notes: Originally titled Colin McRae: DiRT. Native wheel and FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

dirt_2.title: DiRT 2

sources.description: Logitech official compatibility list confirms full 900-degree mode, H-pattern shifter, and FFB support.
Codemasters DiRT series. Full wheel support with 540-degree recommended for rally.

dirt_2.notes: Rally racer with full wheel support. 900-degree capable but 540 recommended for rally. RPCS3: Playable but may crash after extended play.

dirt_3.title: DiRT 3

sources.description: Codemasters DiRT series. Native wheel and FFB support. 540-degree recommended for rally.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status.

dirt_3.notes: Rally racer with native wheel and FFB. 540 degrees recommended. Playable on RPCS3.

dirt_showdown.title: DiRT Showdown

sources.description: Codemasters DiRT series. Native wheel and FFB. Demolition derby focus but supports standard wheel play.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status.

dirt_showdown.notes: Demolition derby-focused DiRT spin-off. Native wheel and FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

race_driver_grid.title: Race Driver: GRID

sources.description: Logitech official compatibility list confirms 200 and 900-degree modes, H-pattern shifter, and FFB.
Codemasters GRID series. Native wheel and FFB support.

race_driver_grid.notes: First GRID game. Full wheel support with 200 and 900-degree modes. Playable on RPCS3. 540 recommended.

grid_2.title: GRID 2

sources.description: Codemasters GRID series. Native wheel and FFB support. Arcade-sim hybrid handling.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status.

grid_2.notes: Arcade-sim hybrid racer. Native wheel and FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

f1_2010.title: F1 2010

sources.description: Logitech official compatibility list confirms 900-degree mode, H-pattern, clutch, shift LEDs, and FFB for G27.
Codemasters F1 series. Native wheel and FFB. Game hardcodes ~220-360 degree lock for F1 car realism.

f1_2010.notes: First Codemasters F1 game. Native wheel and FFB. 360 degrees recommended. RPCS3: Playable but virtual G27 may show controller disconnected.

f1_2011.title: F1 2011

sources.description: Codemasters F1 series. Consistent native wheel and FFB support. 360 degrees for F1 cars.
Same engine and wheel implementation as F1 2010/2012. Logitech G25/G27 confirmed compatible.

f1_2011.notes: Codemasters F1 series. Native wheel and FFB. 360 degrees for F1 cars. RPCS3 status: Ingame.

f1_2013.title: F1 2013

sources.description: Codemasters F1 series. Native wheel and FFB. Includes classic F1 cars content.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status. Almost 100% compatible with wheel.

f1_2013.notes: Codemasters F1 series with classic cars mode. Native wheel and FFB. 360 degrees. Playable on RPCS3.

need_for_speed_the_run.title: Need for Speed: The Run

sources.description: EA NFS series on PS3. Partial wheel support with FFB. Arcade-focused handling benefits from low rotation.
Same EA NFS era as Hot Pursuit 2010. Arcade handling with 270 degrees to minimize dead zone.

need_for_speed_the_run.notes: Cross-country NFS on Frostbite 2. Partial wheel support with FFB. RPCS3 status: Ingame (freezing issues).

wrc_fia_world_rally_championship.title: WRC: FIA World Rally Championship

sources.description: Milestone WRC series. Native Logitech wheel and FFB support. 540-degree recommended for rally.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status.

wrc_fia_world_rally_championship.notes: First Milestone WRC game (distinct from Evolution Studios PS2 series). PAL-only release. Native wheel and FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

wrc_2_fia_world_rally_championship.title: WRC 2: FIA World Rally Championship

sources.description: Milestone WRC series. Native wheel and FFB support. 540 degrees for rally.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status.

wrc_2_fia_world_rally_championship.notes: Second Milestone WRC. PAL-only release. Native wheel and FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

wrc_3_fia_world_rally_championship.title: WRC 3: FIA World Rally Championship

sources.description: Milestone WRC series. Native wheel and FFB support. 540 degrees for rally.
RPCS3 Wiki confirms Playable status.

wrc_3_fia_world_rally_championship.notes: Third Milestone WRC. PAL-only release. Native wheel and FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

midnight_club_los_angeles.title: Midnight Club: Los Angeles

sources.description: Logitech official PS3 compatibility list confirms FFB support for G25/G27.
Community reports confirm wheel works with FFB but no advanced features (H-pattern, clutch).

midnight_club_los_angeles.notes: Open-world street racer. Partial wheel support with FFB. No H-pattern or clutch. PS3/360 exclusive (never on PC).

motorstorm_apocalypse.title: MotorStorm: Apocalypse

sources.description: Community reports indicate wheel support added in a post-launch patch. MotorStorm 1 and Pacific Rift had no wheel support.
Evolution Studios added wheel support for Apocalypse unlike predecessors. Off-road racing benefits from 540 degrees.

motorstorm_apocalypse.notes: PS3-exclusive off-road racer. Partial wheel support added via patch (MotorStorm 1-2 had none). Playable on RPCS3.

initial_d_extreme_stage.title: Initial D: Extreme Stage

sources.description: Sega Initial D series. 540-degree rotation matches arcade cabinets (ID4-ID8). Japan/Asia-only PS3 release.
RPCS3: Playable but virtual G27 does not register inputs (GitHub issue 17317). Works on real PS3 hardware.

initial_d_extreme_stage.notes: Japan/Asia-only PS3 port of arcade Initial D. Native wheel support on real hardware. 540 degrees matching arcade cabinets. RPCS3: wheel inputs currently broken.

sega_rally_revo.title: Sega Rally Revo

sources.description: Logitech official PS3 compatibility list confirms FFB support for G25/G27.
Sega Rally series uses 270-degree arcade-style steering. Console reboot.

sega_rally_revo.notes: Console reboot of Sega Rally. Partial wheel support with FFB. 270-degree arcade handling. Playable on RPCS3.

ferrari_challenge_trofeo_pirelli.title: Ferrari Challenge: Trofeo Pirelli

sources.description: Logitech official PS3 compatibility list confirms wheel and FFB support.
Community describes FFB as functional but underwhelming. Basic wheel support works.

ferrari_challenge_trofeo_pirelli.notes: Ferrari-licensed racer. Partial wheel support with weak FFB. Playable on RPCS3.

blur.title: Blur

sources.description: Power-up arcade racer. Basic wheel mapping likely works. 270 degrees for arcade handling.
Community reports mixed wheel compatibility. Delisted from all storefronts.

blur.notes: Power-up arcade racer from Project Gotham Racing devs. Wheel support unconfirmed. Delisted everywhere. RPCS3 status: Ingame.

formula_one_championship_edition.title: Formula One Championship Edition

sources.description: Studio Liverpool (ex-Psygnosis). PS3 launch F1 title. Full Logitech wheel support with FFB.
Sequel to PS2 Formula One 05/06 (both in database). F1 games use ~360-degree rotation for realism.

formula_one_championship_edition.notes: PS3-exclusive F1 game by Studio Liverpool. Full wheel support with FFB. Successor to PS2 Formula One series.

on_the_road_truck_simulator.title: On The Road - The Truck Simulator

sources.description: Steam store page and community confirm steering wheel support with known FFB compatibility issues across wheel models
Truck simulator standard: 900-degree wheel rotation matches real truck steering, confirmed by genre convention (ETS2, ATS, Alaskan Road Truckers)

on_the_road_truck_simulator.notes: Truck simulator competing with ETS2/ATS. Wheel support implemented but FFB inconsistent across wheel models. Developer provides dedicated FFB Test App.

ride_6.title: RIDE 6

sources.description: Motorcycle racing game. Consistent with all prior RIDE titles - no steering wheel support.
Motorcycle racing game from well-known developer. All titles in this developer's catalog consistently have no wheel support - motorcycles use body lean and dual-stick controls, not steering wheels.

ride_6.notes: Latest RIDE entry. Motorcycle racing, no wheel support. 200+ motorcycles.

nascar_arcade_rush.title: NASCAR Arcade Rush

sources.description: PCGamingWiki confirms arcade-style NASCAR game with controller support but no dedicated steering wheel support
Steam community discussions confirm no wheel support. Pure arcade racer with boosts and jumps.

nascar_arcade_rush.notes: Arcade-style NASCAR game with boosts, jumps, nitro. No dedicated wheel support.
